item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, March 25, 2025 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Samsung CEO Jong-hee Han has died (92 points | 28 comments)
2. An AI bubble threatens Silicon Valley, and all of us (80 points | 41 comments)
3. German parliament votes as a Git contribution graph (471 points | 137 comments)
4. Quad9 – A public and free DNS service for a better security and privacy (38 points | 16 comments)
5. Hann: A Fast Approximate Nearest Neighbor Search Library for Go (7 points | discuss)
6. Search My Site – open-source search engine for personal and independent websites (169 points | 41 comments)
7. Coding Isn't Programming (102 points | 90 comments)
8. Closing the Chapter on OpenH264 (36 points | 17 comments)
9. Writing your own C++ standard library from scratch (96 points | 74 comments)
10. Triforce – a beamformer for Apple Silicon laptops (554 points | 200 comments)
11. Reflecting on WikiTok (86 points | 23 comments)
12. Spammers are better at SPF, DKIM, and DMARC than everyone else (227 points | 110 comments)
13. Qwen2.5-VL-32B: Smarter and Lighter (495 points | 258 comments)
14. Tim, don't kill my vibe (19 points | 13 comments)
15. Status as a Service (2019) (54 points | 26 comments)
16. A study reveals that deciduous trees' roots remain active in winter (26 points | 8 comments)
17. The Lost Towers of the Guelph-Ghibelline Wars (62 points | 22 comments)
18. High‑dose Vitamin D reduces disease activity in early multiple sclerosis onset (71 points | 24 comments)
19. WWI's 'Dazzle' Camouflage Seemed Effective Due to Unexpected Optical Trick (92 points | 55 comments)
20. A pilot makes a tough call and cancels the flight because of some alarming signs (5 points | discuss)
21. If you get the chance, always run more extra network fiber cabling (12 points | discuss)
22. Three Hundred Years Later, a Tool from Isaac Newton Gets an Update (124 points | 34 comments)
23. OpenID Coming to SSH (18 points | 4 comments)
24. The Great Barefoot Running Hysteria of 2010 (119 points | 125 comments)
25. X’s director of engineering, Haofei Wang, has left the company (60 points | 64 comments)
26. Battling the Blaze: Artifacts from the history of firefighting (10 points | 1 comment)
27. The Hartlib Papers (9 points | discuss)
28. What Is the Most Minimal Agentic Coder You Can Write? (15 points | 6 comments)
29. The Phony Comforts of AI Optimism (15 points | discuss)
30. Brain Scans of Infants Reveal the Moment We Start Making Memories (83 points | 39 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, March 25, 2025 at 2:15 PM UTC
